results.title: Douglas Mawson: the survivor
results.brief_description: During an expedition to Antarctica in 1912, Mawson’s two companions perished leaving him, ill and weak, to struggle back alone to a base camp at Commonwealth Bay. A reconstruction of the tragic expedition is the pivot of the documentary, which also includes interviews with the explorer-scientist’s daughters, contemporaries and students.

results.title: Doubletalk
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Alan Beattie
results.brief_description: Shows a young man calling for his first date with a girl when he is invited in to meet her parents. The sound track reveals not only the spoken conversation, but the unspoken thoughts of all the characters.

results.title: Double Trouble
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
One of the earliest works made by Callas using a Fairlight Computer Video Instrument (CVI) processor, a pioneering compositing and special effects system he utilised regularly from the mid 1980s to early 1990s. ‘Double Trouble’ is the first video made by Callas for a large exterior street screen form (in Tokyo). The image appears as though spliced into vertical halves, an array of imagery and characters appearing in double on either side of the division, and moving with alternating motion upwards and downwards. This two-frame animation technique creates two images from one checkerboard stencil which are then reversed, or asynchronously ‘mirrored’, producing an apt metaphor for cultural differences in ‘body language’ between East and West.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.

The image appears as though spliced into vertical halves, an array of imagery and characters appearing in double on either side of the division, and moving with alternating motion upwards and downwards. This two-frame animation technique creates two images from one checkerboard stencil which are then reversed, or asynchronously ‘mirrored’, producing an apt metaphor for cultural differences in ‘body language’ between East and West.

results.title: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and General Learning Corporation
results.brief_description: Crow and Lion, on an outer space trip, find a cell which begins to divide. The division continues until it approaches a crisis point: the two friends know the spaceship cannot contain the increasing volume of cells. A calculation has to be made to see how many days they can last. The computer read-out demonstrates a number pattern upon which a prediction can be made. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Double thread
results.creator_credit: G R Instruction and Mary Field
results.brief_description: How the daily routine is organised for the children’s own needs in a modern well-equipped nursery school in England. Every activity is designed to help the individual child’s development, and to encourage their adjustment to social and group relationships. The “double thread” refers to the inter-relations of home and kindergarten in the growing child’s life.
